alert.note: Alert for Greer; Jackson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 8:25PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Salt Fork Red River near Mangum affecting Greer and Jackson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Salt Fork Red River near Mangum. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect near bankfull stages along the river in Harmon... Greer... and Jackson counties. No towns or highways are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 2.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The Salt Fork Red River is expected to rise to a crest of 8.4 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 830 AM CDT.
